ovdesc.p: PRE-SYNDICATION FILE is made available for input of basic details of syndication.

This file would contain details of the amount of the loan that is syndicated, the lead manager, co-manager etc to the issue, underwriting made and devolved, details of participants and their share in the syndicate and so on.

If the Facility is granted to a conglomerate rather than a single customer, creation of customer table is mandatory for each of the company that may be involved. CUSTOMER.LIABILITY field in the CUSTOMER table is used for credit grouping purposes. This field allows customer exposure to be consolidated at the branch or country level by the LIMIT application, while analysing risk. It also populates a T24 table CUSTOMER.LIABILITY listing out all the liability numbers (customer numbers) that come under the parent customer.

For such type of syndication that is granted to a group, the parent customer reference is input in the CUSTOMER field in the PRE-SANCTION file. Drawings under the Facility would be permitted to any of the customers who have been linked to the parent customer through CUSTOMER.LIABILITY. The extent to which each company may draw on the Facility may be effectively controlled through the existing LIMIT application in T24 as well as by appropriate definition of Tranches in FACILITY file.

In the PRESYNDICATION.FILE the bank may record the date and amount of the mandate, the type of credit line that is solicited, the banks to whom information memorandum is circulated, their responses to such circulation, details of underwriting made and subscriptions brought by each underwriter, details of participation interest received and allotted, details of underwriting that has been devolved and parties involved.
Once the entire credit line is tied up, by flagging CREATE.FACILITY field, the appropriate facility files could be created.

Indicates the liquidation account for the underwriting fee. Account mentioned in this field should be denominated in the same currency of as in field SL.CURRENCY and this rule is applicable within each multi-value set. On creation of FACILITY, accounting entries would be raised debiting this account for the aggregate underwriting fee payable for the respective facility.

In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application.
Account input in this field should be denominated in the same currency as SL.CURRENCY.

Indicates the type of interest rate that is to be used for the credit. The following values are pre-defined
1 = Fixed interest. The rate of interest charged on the credit line is fixed through the life of the Facility. The rate quoted includes spread if any.

2 = Floating (linked to Basic Interest table). The rate of interest that would change on a non-determined basis with immediate impact. Input in the form of a valid key from BASIC.RATE.TEXT with associated rate defined in BASIC.INTEREST table. If this type of rate type is chosen a positive or negative spread could also be defined separately.
The value input here is defaulted on to the FACILITY record created.
1 numeric character
Only allowed values are 1 and 2.
Optional Input. System would default 1 (Fixed) should there be no input

The role played by each party in the syndicate could be recorded in this set of fields. In a syndicate, a particular role could be assigned to more than one party. Classic examples of types of roles are Agent, Lead Manager, Co-Manager, Manager etc.
Upto 99 different types of roles could be defined in SL.ROLES and the appropriate value could be drilled down in this field.
2 digit numeric value in range 01 - 99
Must be a valid ID on SL.ROLES table.
When SL.FUNCTION is Participant and available for fronting is defined, Agent role id and customer is mandatory.
Contains the reference number of the appropriate interest rate that would be used for interest calculation purposes.
A rate change on the interest rate table will automatically, during End of Day, all contracts linked to the basic interest table
1-4 numeric characters. Optional input
Input mandatory if INT.RATE.TYPE is 2 (Floating) and not allowed other wise.
This field is used to indicate whether the Facility granted if REVOLVING or NON REVOLVING type.

A revolving type facility is re-instated on repayment of the drawings made (a classic example being working capital finance), while a non-revolving facility is of reducing type and may be drawn only once.

If LIQUIDATION.MODE chosen is INTERNAL, a Revolving Facility is re-instated only if the principal portion is repaid using SL.OD.SETTLE application. For option AUTOMATIC in field LIQUIDATION.MODE such reinstatement would happen on processing of maturity of the loan.
Only wither of two values REVOLVING or NON-REVOLVING is accepted
Value input here would get defaulted to FACILITY.
Associated multi-value field under SL.CURRENCY
Name of the underwriter on whom the un-subscribed portion or part thereof has been devolved. Multivalued field in order to assist recording of devolvement on more than one party.
Can only be an existing underwriter under the mandate.
Currently not in use.

1-9 type A alphanumeric characters date field

This field contains the identification number assigned to the customer (borrower) and will accept the customer's mnemonic also. The system will use this number to identify the borrower of the credit line as well as to obtain the customer's name and address for delivery purposes.
3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or 1-10 numeric character customer number
Must be a valid record on the CUSTOMER table
Mandatory input

Field that indicates the type of devolvement. Currently, only value MANUAL is supported. In the event of under subscription, the user may have to manually apportion the un-subscribed portion amongst the existing underwriters.
Only allowed value for input is MANUAL

YES/NO indicator to show whether there has been any devolvement of underwriting. In the event that aggregate subscriptions received are less than the mandate amount, the difference is devolved amongst the underwriters in the agreed proportion. The apportionment of the un-subscribed portion amongst the underwriters are done manually as the manner of devolvement would differ on a case to case basis. This field indicates whether there has been any devolvement or not.
Optional input.
Only allowed values are YES and NO.
Value Null means NO.

Extent of subscription (participation) brought in by the underwriter. If any value is entered in this field, equivalent participations need to be recorded. In other words, aggregate of Amount Sought by all the participants should be greater than (or equal to) the aggregate subscriptions brought by all the underwriters within each SL.CURRENCY multi-value set.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point.
Amount entered should be greater than zero.
Aggregate Amount.Sought should be greater than or equal to aggregate Subs.Brought within each SL.Currency multi-value set.
Extent of aggregate underwriting expressed as percentage of SL.AMOUNT
System maintained field
User input not allowed.

Amount of underwriting commission payable based on amount underwritten and percentage fee payable. System maintained field. Value in this field would be updated with fresh underwriting and change of fee percentage. Amount in this field is expressed in SL.CURRENCY
The net commission payable would be debited to the Uw Fee Account and credited to the respective underwriter's account on creation of FACILITY
System maintained field

Short description of the syndication. 3-15 character alphanumeric value would be accepted

The party assigned to the role specified in the earlier field. In a syndicate a certain role like Manager could be assigned to more than one party. Hence, this field could be sub-valued to assign more than one party to a particular role.

3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or 1-10 numeric character customer number
Must be a valid ID on the CUSTOMER table

Date on which the pre-syndication work is expected to commence. The pre-syndication process starts with receiving the mandate from the customer and ends with creation of facility after the entire credit line is tied up. The start and end of this period is defined in this set of fields for information.
1-9 type (A) alpha numeric characters.
Can only be later than the Presyn start date

1-9 type A alpha numeric characters

INPUT VALUE

1-14 numeric characters plus decimal point
Mandatory input. Value should be greater than zero
Associated multi-valued field under SL.CURRENCY
Aggregate of the amount participated (AMT.ALLOT) should be equal to value in this field in order to create the FACILITY. This rule is applicable to each multi-value set
Field that determines nature of role played by T24 bank in the syndicate. The bank could play any of the three roles namely
AGENT - In this instance the bank does not participate by way of subscription and only manages the syndicate
AGENT cum PARTICIPANT - The bank handles the Agency functions and is also a subscriber (participant) to the syndicate.
MERE PARTICIPANT - The bank is only a participant
Only allowed values are A (Agent) AP (Agent cum Participant) and P (Only Participant)
Mandatory Input
Description of the nature of credit line that is syndicated. Free text field to enable the user to input the purpose of the mandate and other remarks
Maximum length is 35 characters
Minimum subscription required for grant of facility. This is expressed as a percentage of the mandate amount (SL.AMOUNT) or the amount sought by the borrower. Recorded for information only.
Two digit numeric value between 1-99 would be accepted
Optional input
End date for the pre-syndication activity.
1-9 (A) type alphanumeric characters
Mandatory input
Should be later than the Presynd.start.date

Fields Req Bank to Comments are used to record details of circulation of information memorandum. When a mandate is floated, the information memorandum is circulated amongst many banks who could be prospective participants. The details of banks name to whom the memo was circulated, their responses and comments are recorded in this set of fields.
In Req.Bank field, the name of the bank to whom the memo was sent is input. This is a multi-valued field in order to record details of memo sent to various banks.
3-35 character alphanumeric free text field.
Once the entire credit line is tied up, value YES could be input in this field to create the FACILITY records.

In order to create the FACILITY, the Total.Part.Amt should be equal to SL.AMOUNT within each multi-value set. On authorisation, as many FACILITY records as defined in Presyn file would be created in IHLD status with necessary default information.
Only allowed value is YES

Identification number or Mnemonic assigned to the Underwriter. When underwriting details are entered in the Presyn file, this set of fields could be used to record the name of the underwriter, date of the agreement, amount and percentage underwritten and fee payable for underwriting.
3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or 1-10 numeric character customer number
Must be a valid ID on the customer table
If SL.FUNCTION is P (Only Participant), only OWN.CUST.REF in SL.PARAMETER would be accepted.

Example;

The date by which the Req.bank is expected to furnish its acceptance is indicated in this field. When an information memo is circulated, it could have validity period within which the prospective bank is expected to revert with its acceptance. The end date by which response is to be intimated is input here.
1-9 type A alpha numeric character date field.
Optional input

Identification number or mnemonic assigned to the customer who is willing to participate in the syndicate. This set of fields is used to record details of participation like name of participant, extent of participation sought and allotted and the commitment fee payable to each party.
3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or 1-10 numeric character customer code
Must be a valid record on the CUSTOMER table

Field used to define the status of the pre-syndication activity. The pre-syndication process would go through various stages commencing from receiving the mandate from the borrower till it is fully subscribed. Typical stages in pre-syndication are Mandate received, Information Memo Circulated, Underwriting in progress, Subscribed, Participation Allotted etc.

Such stages can be listed in a table called SL.STATUS and the appropriate value maintained in the pre-syndication record. This field is typically user-maintained and not system updated in order to cater to varied requirement.
Two digit numeric character
Must be a valid ID on SL.STATUS

Field used to record the rate of commitment fee payable to each participant. Value recorded in this field would be defaulted while creating the FACILITY. Fee payable to each participant within every SL.CURRENCY set may vary.
1-10 numeric characters plus decimal point
Value entered must be greater than zero
Maximum allowed value is 100
A unique reference number that identifies a particular contract.

Contract numbers may be generated automatically. For automatic generation, appropriate indicator must be set by the system supervisor. Where automatic generation is supported, depression of F3 key at the ID prompt supplies the next contract reference.
12 type A alphanumeric characters

This field is used to record that share that is finally allotted to the participant by the Agent. When a mandate is floated, participation interests could be received for more than the amount sought by the borrower, resulting in over-subscription. In consultation with the borrower, the Agent would then allot each participant its share in the syndicate.
Amount allotted to each participant may not exceed the amount sought. In order to create the FACILITY, aggregate of AMT.ALLOT should equal SL.AMOUNT within each multi-value set
1-14 numeric characters plus decimal point
Value entered in this field may not exceed AMT.SOUGHT

Field used to record the amount of share that the participant has sought (willing to participate) out of the mandate amount. When a mandated is floated, participations could be received from various parties, each seeking a particular share. The extent of exposure that a participant has indicated that it would take is recorded here.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas
Value entered should be greater than zero
